nav.div: Greenwood School District » News » What's New » Public Health Concerns: COVID-19

span.style: color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;

div.span:
Whenever public health concerns garner widespread attention (such as the emergence of COVID-19) schools are often asked if special measures are needed. Our district’s response to public health emergencies is based on following guidance or directives issued from public health agencies such as the PA Department of Health and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
Please check this page and the document container below for updates regarding COVID-19

input.name: ctl00$ContentPlaceHolder1$ctl16$hfCanUseMultiSelect

div.style: float: right; position: absolute; display: none

div.img:
A Note about Public Health Concerns Whenever public health concerns garner widespread attention (such as the emergence of COVID-19) schools are often asked if special measures are needed. Our district’s response to public health emergencies is based on following guidance or directives issued from public health agencies such as the PA Department of Health and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
At this time, those agencies are not recommending schools implement special measures beyond the usual suggestions for limiting the spread of illness, such as classroom sanitation practices we already routinely implement.
Best Practices For Reducing the Spread of Illness
Cover coughs and sneezes
Wash hands often and thoroughly
Avoid sharing eating utensils and cups/bottles
Clean all “high touch” surfaces daily
Monitor your symptoms
If your child is displaying symptoms of an illness, contact your primary care provider and keep your child at home. Absences from school due to illness are considered excused.
Additional Resources of information:
CDC: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
PA Dept. of Health: Coronavirus
World Health Organization: Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak
